data.title: Fix audio can't resume in iOS platform
data.body:
Fixed audio can not resume if it is interrupted cause by an incoming phone call

Fixes #7905.

data.title: No support for depth buffer alpha-testing
data.body:
Currently Godot only seems to support transparent textures which don't use depth buffering and are instead depth sorted. This works okay for some simple cases, but the lack of depth buffering can really bite you if you have, for example, intersecting transparent geometry, which may render inconsistently.

In OpenGL it is possible to test the alpha value of a pixel when writing to the depth buffer, and thus have working depth buffering for transparent textures, albeit this is only suited to 1-bit transparency (all pixels either fully opaque or fully transparent).

Godot supporting depth-buffered transparency would be very useful to me. I wanted to make a game which used 2D pixel art sprites in a 3D environment, but having to rely on depth sorting rather than depth buffering caused all sorts of unfixable rendering issues.

data.title: Collision shape gizmo isn't updated upon changing the shape
data.body:
In the editor, changes made to a collision shape aren't immediately reflected in the 3D editor.
The only way I can get it updated is to select a different node and then reselect the collision shape node.

data.title: Issue about Rigidbody2D when changed from STATIC to RIGID
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win 10 - v2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
As for Rigidbody2D , when I changed its mode from RIGID to STATIC , it works properl but not vice versa. When its converted from STATIC to RIGID , it won't be affected by gravity until something touches it. (Well, if I remembered properly, in one of my projects, it's still immovable, though mode has been changed into RIGID).


**Steps to reproduce:**


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
Left Click to change the one beneath from STATIC to RIGID


[Physics Test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1029424/Physics.Test.zip)

data.title: Could not find cursor theme Manjaro Linux
data.body:
**Manjaro Linux (4.11-ck) Godot 2.1.3**


**Issue description:**
I'm using Godot from Steam. And this error comes out:
`WARNING: initialize: Could not find cursor theme
   At: platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:346.`

**Steps to reproduce:**
`abc@abc-pc ..am/steam/steamapps/common/Godot Engine % ./godot.x11.opt.tools.64 `

Is it an X error or some thing else, i'm not sure.
Any help would be appreciated...

data.title: First mouse click is ignored / does not work
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
osx 3.0 current master

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
The first mouse press gets ignored sometimes -> to click on something I have to double click.

I finally found a pattern so I open the issue, (it was discussed before already. Couldn't find it though...)

This happens when I send input events (click on) to the godot window during loading.

**Steps to reproduce:**
start godot. click on the loading screen. click on any ui element -> you will need to press twice that the button works.

data.title: Godot doesn't respond after running
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64-bit
x86
Intel HD Graphics 520 + Nvidia GeForce 940M
Godot 2.1.3 Win64
**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I opened the .exe, and a black command line window opened with the following:
EXEC PATHP??: C:\Users\P-Star7\Downloads\Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64.exe\Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64.exe
EXEC PATHP??: C:\Users\P-Star7\Downloads\Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64.exe\Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64.exe
EXEC PATHP??: C:\Users\P-Star7\Downloads\Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64.exe\Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64.exe
DETECTED MONITORS: 1
And the main Godot window has no label and is white, and just never responds. So you have to close it by clicking until Windows asks you to close it.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download the Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64
2. Run the .exe

**Notes**
I tried to run as administrator, use compatibility troubleshooter, and run with both graphics cards by right-clicking. But nothing changed in any of these methods. Both graphics drivers are fully upgraded. I downloaded the Realtech OpenGL statistics viewer thing and it said that my version was 4.4. I also have DirectX 9.0c and 12 on the computer. The OpenGL statistics reported the version of DirectX as 9.0c but dxdiag reports it as 12. Maybe this is affecting Godot, as it is an OpenGL application?

data.title: Fix crash in BC decompression
data.body: If mipmaps present, the final reported image size was wrong, usually 0 and that was making the subsequent steps to crash.

data.title: Fix crash in BC decompression (2.1)
data.body: If mipmaps present, the final reported image size was wrong, usually 0 and that was making the subsequent steps to crash.

data.title: Tool mode does nothing (hot take)
data.body:
Windows 10 x64, Godot 2.1.3 stable, official

Adding tool mode to a script on a Node object in the scene tree should allow it to run in the editor as the current documentation states.

I have

```gdscript
tool
extends Node

func _ready():
	print('henlo')
	set_process(true)

func _process(delta):
	print('henlo again')
```

and I expect `henlo` and `henlo again` to show up in the output before playing the project, but nothing happens until I press play. Then it works as expected, but not working in the editor.

Am I missing something?

data.title: Top of screen cut off and mouse Y position off (Windows 10, Intel drivers regression)
data.body:
Windows 10 PRO
Godot 2.1.3 & Latest 3.x
Intel 620 graphics card

When opening a project the top of the screen is cut off. You can't see the top bar where Scene, Import, Tools, etc are.
Mouse y position is off by like half a button width. This happens in the project list and when you open a project. You have to move the mouse below the buttons to click on them. 
I also tried running in self contained mode by create .\_sc\_ 

![godotcutoff](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/340016/26430918/dabf843a-40a5-11e7-84b1-5374c4697613.png)

data.title: Revive PathEditorPlugin.
data.body:
Adapted the plugin to recent changes in input classes and pool arrays.
Fixed an out-of-bounds bug in the process.

Doesn't display anything for a single point, but this is likely an issue related to mesh-from-array functions. Can open an issue for that once this is merged.

Fixes #8886.

Applied clang-format in a separate commit, can rebase once the changes are approved.

data.title: Fix the text_edit InputEventKey handling.
data.body:
Fixes #8894 
I guess that actually the [duplicate](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/resource.cpp#L188) method is broken,
but that's not a human-readable code (at least for me ;-)

data.title: Better flat stylebox with rounded corners
Change InputEventScreenTouch from struct to class
data.body: I'm pretty sure it was supposed to be a class too, as is every other `InputEvent` type.

data.title: Listening to socket fails when exporting to HTML5
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Ubuntu 16.04 with Godot 2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**

My godot project listens to a socket using this code:

```
var port = 4545
var server = TCP_Server.new()

func _ready():
	if server.listen(port) == 0:
		print("Server running on port " + str(port))
		set_process(true)
	else:
		print("Cannot listen on port " + str(port))
		get_tree().quit()

```

I export it to HTML5 and run it locally using the python internal webserver: `sudo python -m SimpleHTTPServer`. When I open the webpage, it starts loading and fails with the following message:

```
**WARNING**: At: ./drivers/unix/socket_helpers.h:87:_socket_create() - Unable to set/unset IPv4 address mapping over IPv6
bad ioctl syscall 21537
abort("bad ioctl syscall 21537") at Error
    at jsStackTrace (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.js:1:17538)
    at stackTrace (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.js:1:17709)
    at abort (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.js:3:12282)
    at ___syscall54 (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.js:1:174652)
    at qoj (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.asm.js:27:104858)
    at Array.CRa (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.asm.js:18:126238)
    at Array.cRi (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.asm.js:14:809595)
    at Array.MHh (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.asm.js:16:643720)
    at p4i (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.asm.js:14:1161263)
    at UA (http://127.0.0.1:8000/index.asm.js:23:909097)
If this abort() is unexpected, build with -s ASSERTIONS=1 which can give more information.
**EXCEPTION**:
```

data.title: White Themes! Editor Theme font color based on theme color
data.body:
Bright themes are currently not supported, because the font color is white.
It should change to black after a specific threshold.

data.title: Godot Engine crashes on font change from the editor (using tool)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Home 64bit
Godot Engine 2.1.3 (Steam, stable)

**Issue description:**
If you try to change the font size from within the editor, Godot Engine crashes. 
**set_font_size(value)** (on line 29) in _menu_item.gd_ causes the crash.

It also crashes if you try to use **set("font_size", value)** instead of set_font_value.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open **menu_item.tscn** or **main_menu_scene.tscn** and change the menu item font size from within the editor (using export). 

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Bugged When Changing Font Size From Editor.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1025414/Bugged.When.Changing.Font.Size.From.Editor.zip)

data.title: Join text menus on the top-left, move shortcut buttons to new locations (Preliminary work towards achieving the changes discussed in #8865.)
data.body:
Let's test the proposed changes in #8865 so far and see if the new locations for the menus and buttons are a good idea.

Note: The old stuff in the top-right (volume, updates, etc), are still being created but simply not added to the GUI. This is because it needs to be disconnected first from other places inside Godot, otherwise it will crash.

data.title: Game window centered by default
data.body:
Every time I encounter a YouTube tutorial it strikes me as how many times the game window is **manually centered** after running. In the most recent GDquest's tutorials backed by a KickStarter you can see this same behavior: [Example](https://youtu.be/xUSEeXDtwIw?t=34s)

I think that the **default setting** for the game window should be **centered**. It is something that I see MANY people is struggling with and it is hard to find that settings option if you don't know a lot about the program's interface.

I'll try to do a pull request myself but I'm not sure if I'll be able to make it properly.

data.title: canvas_item_add_circle does not work
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
osx 3.0 current master

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
the call to `vs-> canvas_item_add_circle();`
does not draw anything in godot 3.0. I think draw polygon also might be broken.

If someone can fix that would be great. I don't have time soon and would love to create a pr with the new style box. I'm finished. But I want to test first. And maybe fix things.
**Steps to reproduce:**
I'm working on FlatStyleBox and implement rounded corners. I'm using circles for that.
I started in godot 2.1 with gd script to create the logic. So I know that the draw circle function works in 2.1
Than I implemented the rounded style boxes in C++. 
To confirm I also tried 3.0 in GDScript. And I can confirm, that the draw circle function also does not work there either.

data.title: Mouse wheel scrolling doesn't work

data.title: Certain keyboard shortcuts don't seem to be working
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04 - 2e3145de65257ed39a5d01c5592ea0fb90cd00ba

**Issue description:**
Certain keyboard shortcuts don't appear to be working (not sure if these are regressions, or if this was never the intent). Examples:
- Hitting `Delete` while having a node selected (either in the scene menu, or in the scene itself) doesn't do anything
- Hitting Ctrl+S doesn't save the scene.
- Etc?

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a new scene and attempt any of the shortcuts above (and probably some other ones?).
